A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
The film is technically very strong\, contains cool new ideas about the lore\, and has excellent performances by Hamill and Driver\, but at the end of the day TLJ is a poorly constructed narrative with characters I simply don't like. 

The film acts as a clear sign that Disney has no overarching plan for this new trilogy and\, worse\, is willing to remove its leadership from responsibility by granting complete freedom to overhyped "auteurs". 

Yes\, I signed up an account to specifically comment on a Star Wars film and yes\, I'm doing it on Christmas Day... but my family is driving me crazy and this has been cathartic.
